snippet: Yazidis helped the Kurds gain control of the city, which has been under the brutal domination of the Islamic State for more than 15 months.
abstract: Kurdish and Yazidi fighters take back city of Sinjar in northern Iraq from Islamic State; victory is marred by Pres Masoud Barzani of Iraqi Kurdish government declaring that city will be incorporated into Kurdistan, as both Iraqi government in Baghdad and Kurdistan Workers' Party believe city is theirs.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and RUKMINI CALLIMACHI

lead_paragraph: Yazidis helped the Kurds gain control of the city, which has been under the brutal domination of the Islamic State for more than 15 months.

headline.main: Kurdish Fighters Retake Iraqi City of Sinjar From ISIS
headline.print_headline: Groups of Rival Fighters Join to Retake Iraqi City Brutally Controlled by ISIS

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
